sentences.sContent: ...It was like living in an age you could never have imagined...
...which could be why fewer people in that group actually made it to that point...
...Fantasy proneness could be considered a tendency to imagine and daydream...
...This behavior may have evolved as dogs gradually learned they could benefit from avoiding conflicts with humans...
...I could tell you everything about every day after that...
...What could have been considered the beginning of a descent is now a potential turning point—the turning point you are most equipped to take full advantage of...
...you could also visit me at my dorm: 101Room at Dorm 1...
...she claimed that she could recall every day of her life since the age of 12...
By the time she was eight, she could read Greek and Latin.
sentences.sCn: 她八岁时就会读希腊文和拉丁文了。

phrases.pCn: 本来能做成的（却没做成）
没人能做到；那么别人也休想

trans.tranOther: used as the past tense of ‘can’ to say what someone was able to do or was allowed to do in the past
